title: [WIP] - Brightcove event cleanup
body:
Brightcove android native was firing too many events and play/pause events were fired on wrong callbacks. 
- Replaced "PLAY" event with "DID_PLAY", and same for pause and seek events. 
- Removed the callback on progress, because it's fired every 10ms or so. 
- Deleted .android file. We don't really need a android specific logic in js. 
- Default style for fullscreen.
- Replace contextWrapper with the activity context, so Brightcove's FullScreenController functions properly

title: WIP: Feat/layout opinion related articles
body:
- adds images to opinion template for related articles
- styles the talet and desktop versions of opinion

TODO: mobile and native layout

title: feat: video lead asset (web)
body:
Support video lead assets for articles. Doing this required:

1. Fixing the layout of the BrightcoveVideo component
2. Refactoring the article.web.js layout to use pure css to move and resize the lead asset at different breakpoints, instead of duplicating the lead asset elements and showing/hiding them on different breakpoints.

title: Article modal image
body:
Started using modal-image instead of image in article lead assets and inline images. 

Only supported in ios/Android and falls back to image in web.

title: Android article design reviews
body:
Article Design Reviews for Android:

- Hide byline if it's empty (Both Web & Android)
- Update paddings on standfirst
- Update line height and padding for byline
- Android specific styleguides to enable android specific font size on article flags

title: transpile packages on postinstall
body:
Currently package consumers need to use babel.
However we can speedup builds by building each package on postinstall.
In order to do this we need:
- move source to a src folder
- use babel to transpile into a dist folder
- adjust the entrypoint to point to dist/index.js
- provide a "dev" entrypoint for webpack for a good DX
- stories and __tests__  may need adjustments its imports

you may like to pick up my work at feat/transpile3 to get started.

body: Minor bugfix to get ads stories working on native

title: refactor components like article-header-label to use render-props
body:
Currently there are a couple components that have almost identical implementation for web and native and only differ by using a responsive - styled-component wrapper.
I suggest to refactor those components to use a render-props to maximize code reuse

title: Add accessibility checks to storybook
body: There are accessibility checks on components in storybook.

title: Refactor Card and List Card
body:
### Problem
Currently Author profile list item uses `card` component. This is not reusable in the `slice` component. 

### Solution
Rename `card` component to `list-card`.
Abstract out the 'card' component used in related-articles in the `article` package into the new `card` component

title: Related articles stories in storybook
body:
- Move related article component from `article` to its own package.
- Have all the combinations of templates and number of articles in the related articles storybook 
- Have an example related article component in an article story.

title: Use semantic tags in all packages
Bundle iOS and Android app as part of test script
Add  proptypes / flowtypes to package .readme files
All packages to have a .readme file
Find a linter for styled components
Create a factory for withResponsive which defaults to using a div
Remove Platform ternary in all packages
body: remove code such as `fontSize: Platform.OS === "android" ? 10 : 12`

title: Improving snapshots
body:
Snapshot testing could use some rationalising. Snapshots are too large, insufficiently readable, and often change as a result of distant refactorings in other parts of the codebase. Some of this may be fixable by writing and enforcing guidelines for snapshot best practices. The rest can be fixed with some simple utility functions to control what goes into snapshots.

Suggestions:

1. By default, don't let implementation details of one component leak into snapshot tests in another (shallow rendering is supposed to fix this, but sometimes we use enzyme.mount() or react-test-renderer for technical reasons, and these do full depth renders).

2. Provide a way for tests to either blacklist parts of the snapshot that they know are not relevant, or  to whitelist the parts that they are interested in.

3. Make an upper limit on the size of individual snapshots, potentially overridable. article.web.test.js.snap is 1.3MB in size with 11 snapshots.

title: Testing responsive components
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->

<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of the component. -->

**Do you want to request a _feature_ or report a _bug_?**
feature
<!-- Please ask questions on the component Slack channel. -->

<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behaviour?**
Responsive features are tested by snapshotting css applied via media queries

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide a Short, Self Contained, Correct, Example http://sscce.org/ as a gist, if possible! -->

**What is the expected behaviour?**
Find a better way to test responsive features. 
Investigate whether JSDOM will support css media queries.
Investigate other approaches such as fructose.

**If this is a feature request, what is the motivation or use case for changing
the behaviour?**
More reliable testing

title: Add script to fail CI on unhoisted packages
body:

Feature

**What is the current behaviour?**

Yarn workspaces happily splits out packages when "hoisted" without notification

**If the current behaviour is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce.**

Change versions of the same package between package deps

CI to fail if packages aren't aligned

To save on yarn time

version and Operating System.**

title: Events not issued from brightcove-video when `directToFullscreen` option set
body:
**BUG**

**What is the current behaviour?**

When (on iOS or Android platforms) `directToFullscreen` option is set no player events are sent.

**What is the expected behaviour?**

Player events should still be sent

title: Validation errors in dev mode
body:
<!-- Please don't delete this template or we'll close your issue -->
<!-- Before creating an issue please make sure you are using the latest version of the component. -->

**Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?**
feature

<!-- Please ask questions on the component Slack channel. -->
<!-- Issues which contain questions or support requests will be closed. -->

**What is the current behaviour?**
Certain areas in this codebase raise errors to warn developers about incorrect usage / errors that cannot be identified through static analysis. For example https://github.com/newsuk/times-components/blob/master/packages/tracking/tracking-context.js#L22 

<!-- A great way to do this is to provide a Short, Self Contained, Correct, Example http://sscce.org/ as a gist, if possible! -->

**What is the expected behaviour?**
Raise errors when running locally, suppress errors for production builds.
Allow configuration to choose whether these errors will be raised as exceptions, written to the console as warnings or send to some other target such as an analytics endpoint.

**If this is a feature request, what is the motivation or use case for changing the behaviour?**
Allow rich validation in dev without affecting runtime performance or user experience.

**Please mention other relevant information such as the browser version, Node.js version and Operating System.**
